content.question: Based on Ibn Battuta's description, which of the following claims can be made about the Swahili Coast?

choices.label: Islam was commonly practiced in the city-states located in this region.
Bantu languages were widely spoken along the entire east coast of Africa.
Portuguese merchants consistently controlled the Indian Ocean trade.
Great Zimbabwe was the primary supplier of grain to the villages located in this region.

content.answer: Islam was commonly practiced in the city-states located in this region.
